name: Overview
data: [{"id":"1b730560-589f-42d7-a651-c8d8a6a231c0","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Group: Results Access and Output Interfaces","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d7c26cef-6c12-4a78-a4ca-8499d4ba773d","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Results Access and Output Interfaces","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" group represents the public API and data-export layer of the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"CallGraphGenerator","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Once the core analysis engines have finished traversing the code, these methods are used to translate the complex, interdependent internal state of the machinery into structured, serializable formats.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"05b96450-b7c8-43c4-ab7b-c00bf0fec18f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This group is organized into three specialized sub-groups, each catering to a different aspect of the analysis: spatial structure (the graph), structural metadata (the files), and symbolic summaries (the entities).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"82c092bc-71b2-43dd-86d2-b0bd492bb2af","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"e35af5ac-a1c1-4482-a86a-f03b8d26045f","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Included Sub-Groups","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c3d9d4b1-71ec-4dee-b982-2a5ecfcb47c5","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Call Graph Structure Outputs","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bc4e86af-ea97-4111-8467-294e34897b3e","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Focuses on the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"spatial connectivity","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of the project. These methods extract the directed edges and nodes that represent function calls. This data is the primary source for generating visual call graphs or dependency trees.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"eea94864-d8f4-4f64-83bf-9a35ff88e1b8","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Data","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": Adjacency lists, source-destination pairs (edges), and graph-compatible definition sets.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c7f09812-43e0-4d03-89e9-1967ffe29037","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Module and Dependency Metadata Outputs","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4e4e2865-55ee-4924-8422-8f002079c768","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Focuses on the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"physical architecture","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of the project. These methods provide an inventory of the files (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Modules","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") involved in the analysis, categorized by their relationship to the project.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"931900af-8df4-4270-bfb1-8696fa37df23","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Data","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": Internal vs. External module registries, file paths (relative to package root), and registries of methods found within each file.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"029dc324-32d7-4ff8-bd3d-c471e3759bc1","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Symbol and Semantic Summary Outputs","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1ce55b82-9b04-42ab-bd86-6f5b612e263f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Focuses on the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"functional entities and findings","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":". These methods provide flat inventories of specific code constructs and the results of diagnostic checks performed during the
